revised_title: Anatomical Study of Arterial Supply to the Human Brain
tldr: This study investigates the distribution of different arteries supplying the human brain through the injection of gelatine containing soluble colors. The research provides detailed information on the arterial supply to various parts of the brain, including the subthalamica, pedunculi, mammillare, and internal capsule. The findings can aid in diagnosing brain softening caused by blocked arteries.
